lead_paragraph: An article on Friday about efforts by the Arizona Cardinals and the Minnesota Vikings to avoid a local television blackout of their N.F.L. playoff games because of sluggish ticket sales referred incorrectly, using information from the N.F.L., to previous playoff blackouts. As the article correctly noted, the Dolphins’ game against the Baltimore Ravens was blacked out in the Miami area in 2002, but the Jets-Raiders game that year was not. (Both Arizona and Minnesota eventually sold enough tickets to avoid blackouts in their markets.).
